content: The FHIR spec includes web pages like http://hl7-fhir.github.io/uslab/patient-uslab.html that indicate that http://hl7-fhir.github.io/uslab/patient-uslab-example1.json is supposed to conform to http://hl7-fhir.github.io/uslab/uslab-patient.html -- but this information doesn't appear to be captured in machine-readable format anywhere. Am I missing it?
(e.g. the examples could include a Profile tag pointing back to the profile; that would make some things easier)
The IG has a place to specify the link from an example to the profile
@Josh Mandel I didn't add the profile tag when creating them. If that is what you are asking you are not missing it.
it is isn the IG resource, but i've been meaning to get around to adding the tag too. but I haven't done that in the new IG publisher yet
Should the authors be adding the meta instead of the tool?
The meta in the example won't impact what profile it'll show up for in the IG.
So do we need that element in ImplementationGuide any more?

I'm not sure why we are talking about the the IG resource?. The IG builds are being split out so there won't be IG examples intermingled with the core examples. I didn't think the IG resource had anything to do with it? Weren't they to link the example resources to the IG profile?
yes they do. but that's so the tools know the link. It now doesn't drive the publishing arrangements
Which means...nothing needs to be done since the problem will go away?
no I think it would be useful for the IGpublisher to assert the profile explicitly
but the authors don't need to do anything
